intro: Scaligeria multijuga, commonly known as the broad-leaved scaligeria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The plant thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas.
